revised_title: Observations on the Inner Colours of Rainbows
tldr: Dr. Langwith observed additional colors and arches within rainbows, which he believed to be a result of the mixing of different color rays. He also noticed that these inner colors were more prominent in the upper parts of the rainbow, suggesting that they may be related to the properties of water droplets in the atmosphere.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
